<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="25%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="73%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Prior to September 2007, the previous peer group included
    Newfield Exploration Company and Pioneer Natural Resources
    Company but excluded Murphy Oil Corporation, Hess Corporation
    and XTO Energy Inc. In consultation with the Consultant, the
    MD&#038;C Committee altered the makeup of the peer group to
    satisfy the need for additional data points and to ensure that
    all of the peer companies are of comparable size to Apache and
    that their primary revenues are from exploration and production
    operations.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -12pt; margin-left: 12pt">
    <B><I>Base Salary</I></B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    We believe that one of the most effective ways to compete in the
    energy industry&#146;s executive labor market is to offer our
    executive officers a competitive base salary. The MD&#038;C
    Committee analyzes each executive officer&#146;s compensation
    using the following process:
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -39pt; margin-left: 39pt">
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;1.&#160;Define the key executive
    positions within the Company in terms of scope and
    responsibility, job complexity, knowledge, experience required,
    and other relevant factors.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -39pt; margin-left: 39pt">
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2.&#160;Rank the executive
    positions on the basis of these factors to establish a logical
    relationship among them.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -39pt; margin-left: 39pt">
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;3.&#160;For the Named Executive
    Officers, develop a salary band using the Market Reference Point
    as the 50th&#160;percentile.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -39pt; margin-left: 39pt">
    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;4.&#160;For other executive
    positions, establish salary ranges by utilizing applicable
    energy industry surveys.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    We generally set our executives&#146; base salaries, including
    those of both our chairman and our chief executive officer, to
    fall between the 50th&#160;and 75th&#160;percentile Market
    Reference Points for executive base salaries. As a general
    policy, we set the base salaries of our Named Executive Officers
    so that the highest salaries are paid to both our chairman and
    our chief executive officer, with lower base salaries for our
    chief financial officer, executive vice president&#160;&#151;
    Canada, and executive vice president&#160;&#151; Egypt. We
    employ this policy in recognition of the fact that the
    responsibilities relating to such positions are of the greatest
    scope for both our chairman and our chief executive officer,
    with more focused scopes for the others.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    26
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 91%; margin-left: 4%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="25%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="73%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    We generally review the base salaries of all executive officers,
    including the Named Executive Officers, every 12 to
    18&#160;months. Each of the chairman and the chief executive
    officer provides his recommendations to the MD&#038;C Committee
    on compensation actions for all executive officers, other than
    themselves. The MD&#038;C Committee, in conjunction with the
    chief executive officer, determines whether to adjust the base
    salaries of our executive officers, including our Named
    Executive Officers, in connection with these reviews. The
    MD&#038;C Committee considers each executive&#146;s benchmarking
    against the Market Reference Point, position and scope of
    responsibilities. In addition to such external market
    considerations, the MD&#038;C Committee also considers internal
    pay equity among our executives, including the Named Executive
    Officers, for base salary planning. The foregoing discussion of
    how the MD&#038;C Committee determines base salaries is not
    intended to be exhaustive, but does summarize the material
    factors considered by the MD&#038;C Committee. The MD&#038;C
    Committee did not find it useful to, and did not attempt to,
    quantify, rank or otherwise assign relative weights to these
    factors. In considering the factors described above, individual
    members of the MD&#038;C Committee may have given different
    weight to different factors. The MD&#038;C Committee conducted
    an overall analysis of the factors described above and viewed
    the totality of the information presented to it, including
    discussions with the Consultant and our senior management.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    The most recent increases in base salary for each of our Named
    Executive Officers was on February&#160;16, 2008 for each of the
    chairman and the chief executive officer, on May&#160;16, 2007
    for the chief financial officer, and on November&#160;1, 2007
    for each of the executive vice president&#160;&#151; Canada and
    the executive vice president&#160;&#151; Egypt.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
    <B><I>Annual<BR>
    Incentive</I></B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    <U>General</U>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    The Company&#146;s executive officers are eligible to receive an
    annual cash incentive bonus tied to achievement by the Company
    of a variety of financial, operational, and strategic objectives
    and to the executive officer&#146;s personal performance. We
    have created separate plans with unique objectives for our
    executive officers to take into account the different levels and
    types of responsibility that the executive officers have within
    the Company. For example, our executive officers, other than our
    Named Executive Officers, with only regional responsibilities
    participate in regional incentive plans that are designed to
    recognize the success of a particular region with respect to
    production, revenue, and cost results, while corporate-level
    plans consider the Company&#146;s overall results. While these
    plans are built upon a mix of objective and subjective factors,
    each plan covering our Named Executive Officers is, on the
    whole, a qualitative analysis and requires the MD&#038;C
    Committee to exercise significant discretion in making
    compensation decisions.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    27
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 91%; margin-left: 4%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="25%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="73%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    The following discussion of the factors considered by the
    MD&#038;C Committee with respect to each of the Company&#146;s
    plans is not intended to be exhaustive, but does summarize the
    material factors considered by the MD&#038;C Committee in making
    its decisions. The MD&#038;C Committee conducted an overall
    analysis of the factors and viewed the totality of the
    information presented to it.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    <U>Chairman and Chief Executive Officer</U>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Each of the Company&#146;s chairman and the chief executive
    officer are eligible to receive an annual cash incentive bonus
    determined after consideration of the Company&#146;s achievement
    of financial, operational, and strategic objectives. This plan,
    which is more comprehensive and less formulaic than those
    available to the other Named Executive Officers, applies only to
    each of our chairman and our chief executive officer because the
    scope of responsibilities to the Company for those positions is
    broader than those of the other executive positions. The
    MD&#038;C Committee policy provides for bonuses awarded under
    this plan targeted at 100&#160;percent of base salary.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    In its determination of the 2007 cash incentive bonus for each
    of the chairman and the chief executive officer, the MD&#038;C
    Committee considered the general health of the Company as
    compared to its peers, the effectiveness of its long-term
    strategy over the last several years, the performance of the
    Company&#146;s stock price compared to its peers during 2007 and
    over the last several years, as well as the following six
    corporate goals (the &#147;Corporate Goals&#148;): production
    growth of 13&#160;percent, reserve growth of between five and
    ten percent, annual earnings above $2.0&#160;billion, record
    annual cash flow, controlling lifting costs per BOE within two
    percent of the prior year, and controlling general and
    administrative expenses within three percent of the prior year.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    These Corporate Goals were proposed by senior management and
    then reviewed, modified and approved by the MD&#038;C Committee
    for 2007. The foregoing discussion of the factors considered by
    the MD&#038;C Committee is not intended to be exhaustive, but it
    does summarize the material factors considered by the MD&#038;C
    Committee in making its decisions with respect to the cash
    incentive bonuses for each of the chairman and the chief
    executive officer. In contrast to the analysis it performs for
    the other executive officers, the MD&#038;C Committee did not
    find it useful to, and did not attempt to, quantify, rank or
    otherwise assign relative weights to these factors. The
    MD&#038;C Committee conducted an overall analysis of the factors
    described above and viewed the totality of the information
    available to it. In contrast to the analysis it performs for the
    other executive officers, the MD&#038;C Committee also focuses
    more on the long-term realization of the Company&#146;s
    strategic goals, the comprehensive performance of the Company
    over several years, and the relative performance of the Company
    compared to its peer group.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    28
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="25%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="73%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    <U>Chief Financial Officer, Executive Vice President&#160;&#151;
    Canada, and Executive Vice President&#160;&#151; Egypt</U>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Each of our other corporate executives, including our chief
    financial officer, executive vice president&#160;&#151; Canada
    and executive vice president&#160;&#151; Egypt, are eligible to
    receive an annual cash incentive bonus determined after
    consideration of the Company&#146;s achievement of financial,
    operational, and strategic objectives and the executive&#146;s
    personal performance. We believe that the financial,
    operational, and strategic objectives discussed below are key
    indicators as to how the Company is measured in the marketplace.
    The MD&#038;C Committee targets bonuses awarded under this plan
    at 75&#160;percent of base salary for the chief financial
    officer, executive vice president &#151;&#160;Canada and
    executive vice president&#160;&#151; Egypt. This annual bonus
    potential is less than for the chairman and the chief executive
    officer because the vice presidents only have responsibility for
    designated operations or regions within the Company and do not
    have responsibility for the Company as a whole.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Seventy-five percent of the 2007 cash incentive bonus for our
    executives under this plan was based 50&#160;percent upon the
    Corporate Goals and 50&#160;percent upon achievement by the
    Company of both basic and extraordinary strategic objectives
    tied to the Company&#146;s business plan. The MD&#038;C
    Committee used a point system that weighted each Corporate Goal
    between ten and 30&#160;percent of the total. If the Company
    overachieved one or more of the Corporate Goals, the executive
    officers were awarded credit above the percentage weight for
    that goal due to the extraordinary nature of these achievements,
    which was the case for 2007. The MD&#038;C Committee also used a
    point system that weighted each basic strategic objective
    between approximately three and 17&#160;percent. If the Company
    overachieved one or more of the basic objectives, or if it
    achieved one or more of the extraordinary objectives, the
    executive officers were awarded additional credit due to the
    extraordinary nature of these achievements, which was the case
    in 2007. The MD&#038;C Committee has subjective discretion in
    determining the relative success of strategic objectives.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    In the case of the executive vice presidents of Canada and
    Egypt, both the chairman and the chief executive officer
    qualitatively assessed the performance of the region under the
    control of such executive officer, considering 2007 results for
    exploration, production, and drilling. Both the chairman and the
    chief executive officer made recommendations to the MD&#038;C
    Committee as to whether additional credit should be given for
    regional achievements.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    The remaining 25&#160;percent of each executive&#146;s eligible
    bonus was based on personal achievement of the executive, as
    determined by the chief executive officer and recommended to the
    MD&#038;C Committee. In general, the leadership and management
    skills of the executive were evaluated. A variety of qualitative
    and quantitative goals and performance results were taken into
    account, such as job responsibility, job complexity and
    successful performance of an executive officer&#146;s business
    unit. However, there was no attempt to quantify, rank or
    otherwise assign relative weights to the factors considered. The
    chief executive officer conducted an overall analysis of such
    factors and considered the totality of the information available
    to him.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
    <B><I>Long-Term<BR>
    Incentive</I></B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Long-term incentives relating to the Company&#146;s common stock
    serve to align the interests of executive officers with those of
    the Company&#146;s stockholders by tying a portion of each
    executive officer&#146;s long-term compensation to the continued
    growth of the Company and the appreciation of our common stock.
    The Company grants a combination of restricted stock units,
    stock options and periodic conditional grants of performance
    shares to fall at the 50th&#160;percentile Market Reference
    Point for long-term incentive amounts. Grants of stock options
    and restricted stock units were made to the Named Executive
    Officers during 2007. No grants of performance shares were made
    in 2007.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    <U>Restricted Stock Units</U>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    In 2007, we granted an aggregate of 124,000 restricted stock
    units under the Company&#146;s Executive Restricted Stock Plan
    and 2007 Omnibus Equity Compensation Plan to the Company&#146;s
    executive officers as a group. As reflected in the Grants of
    Plan Based Awards Table, we granted an aggregate of 59,100
    restricted stock units to the Named Executive Officers listed in
    the Summary Compensation Table. Grants of restricted stock units
    to executive officers, including each Named Executive Officer,
    are proportionate to each officer&#146;s base salary. In 2007,
    individual grants of restricted stock units were based on
    100&#160;percent of base salary and vest ratably over four years.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    In recognition of his past contributions and expected future
    contributions to the Company, Mr.&#160;Farris, our chief
    executive officer, was granted a conditional stock award in
    December 1998, for a total of 100,000&#160;shares of the
    Company&#146;s common stock (230,992&#160;shares after
    adjustment for the stock dividends and stock split). The award
    was composed of five periodic installments, the last of which
    comprised 76,998&#160;shares that vested on January&#160;1,
    2008. Under the terms of the grant agreement, each vested
    installment was paid 60&#160;percent in stock and
    40&#160;percent in cash, from which was deducted required tax
    withholding on the full amount of the vested installment.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 91%; margin-left: 4%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="25%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="73%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Stock options granted to executive officers are proportionate to
    each officer&#146;s base salary, including each of the Named
    Executive Officers, and benefit them only if stockholders also
    benefit from appreciating stock prices. In 2007, executive
    officers received stock option grants based on 100&#160;percent
    of their base salary, and the Company&#146;s chief executive
    officer received a grant based on 300&#160;percent of base
    salary in keeping with the equity compensation awards of the
    Market Reference Point. In May 2007, due to his personal
    circumstances, the chairman of the board requested that he not
    be awarded stock options because of the significant degree to
    which the expense of the award to the Company would exceed the
    benefit of the award to the chairman and his heirs after income
    and estate taxes.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    <U>Performance Shares</U>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    In February 2005, the Company established the 2005&#160;Share
    Appreciation Plan, which was approved by the Company&#146;s
    stockholders in May 2005. Conditional grants were made broadly
    across the Company in May 2005 to essentially all regular, full
    time employees in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom,
    Australia, and Argentina, including the Named Executive
    Officers. The majority of these conditional grants under the
    2005&#160;Share Appreciation Plan were made to non-executive
    officers and are intended to provide specific individual
    incentives toward achieving significant price appreciation for
    the Company&#146;s common stock based on attainment of per share
    price goals of $81 prior to January&#160;1, 2008, and $108 prior
    to January&#160;1, 2009. Benefits are payable under these
    conditional grants, and the right to receive shares will exist,
    only if one or both of the above-referenced share price goals
    are achieved for any ten trading days during any period of 30
    consecutive trading days, but prior to the expiration date of
    the grant. As of June&#160;14, 2007, Apache&#146;s share price
    exceeded the $81 threshold for the required ten days. The first
    installment of 25&#160;percent was issued in July 2007.
    Subsequent installments of 25&#160;percent each will be issued
    in 2008, 2009, and 2010 to participants then employed by the
    Company. As of February&#160;29, 2008, Apache&#146;s share price
    exceeded the $108 threshold for the required ten days. The first
    installment of 25&#160;percent will be issued on or before
    March&#160;28, 2008. Subsequent installments of 25&#160;percent
    each will be issued in 2009, 2010, and 2011 to participants then
    employed by the Company. Since the inception of the
    2005&#160;Share Appreciation Plan, Apache&#146;s long-term
    shareholders have seen the value of the Company more than
    double, increasing market capitalization by more than
    $19&#160;billion. For this achievement, approximately 2,800
    Apache employees will potentially receive shares with total
    value equal to about one percent of the growth in market
    capitalization.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    The MD&#038;C Committee believes that the periodic grant of
    performance shares, otherwise known as conditional grants,
    provides an effective retentive element of compensation in the
    event significant stock price appreciation is achieved. The
    periodic grant of performance shares complements and reinforces
    the overall compensation program.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

    <U>Equity Award Timing</U>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">

<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    The MD&#038;C Committee meets each May to determine annual
    grants of equity awards for the executive officers of the
    Company. Actual grants of options are made by the Stock Option
    Plan Committee of the Company&#146;s board of directors. The
    exercise price for stock option grants is set at the per share
    closing price for Apache common stock on the day on which the
    grant is made. The Company does not back date stock option
    grants. The Company has not and does not time the grant of
    awards in coordination with the release of material, non-public
    information. In the case of a newly-hired executive officer, the
    grant would be submitted for approval at the next regularly
    scheduled meeting of the Stock Option Plan Committee and the
    exercise price would be set on the day of such approval.
</TD>
</TR>

    Apache executive officers are eligible for a limited number of
    benefits as part of the total compensation provided to maintain
    a basic level of market competitiveness. This includes a
    complete diagnostic annual physical, club dues, whole life
    insurance, enhanced long term disability coverage, and continued
    contributions to a deferred compensation plan once limits are
    reached in qualified retirement plans.
</TD>

    In addition, to facilitate efficient business travel and for
    security reasons, the board requires both the chairman and the
    chief executive officer to use the Company&#146;s aircraft for
    both business and personal travel. The Company also provides the
    chairman with an apartment, car and driver.

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
    <B><U>No Stock<BR>
    Ownership<BR>
    Requirements</U></B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Because our Named Executive Officers own a significant number of
    shares of common stock and have been long-term investors in
    Apache, the Company has not seen the necessity to require that
    the Named Executive Officers acquire or hold any amount of
    Company stock. The Company believes that any such requirement
    would have little effect because the thresholds would likely
    fall significantly below the number of shares currently owned.
    As reflected in the Securities Ownership and Principal Holders
    Table, the Named Executive Officers have substantial holdings of
    the Company&#146;s stock despite the absence of such a
    requirement.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">

<P align="center" style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    32
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 91%; margin-left: 4%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="25%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="73%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
    <B><U>2007<BR>
    MD&#038;C<BR>
    Compensation<BR>
    Decisions<BR>
    <BR>
    </U><I>Roles and<BR>
    Responsibilities of the<BR>
    Chairman and<BR>
    the Chief<BR>
    Executive<BR>
    Officer</I></B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Raymond Plank, our chairman of the board of directors, was chief
    executive officer from 1966 until May 2002. From the
    Company&#146;s founding in 1954, his vision, entrepreneurial
    spirit, and determination have contributed to shaping Apache as
    it evolved from a small company that organized drilling
    partnerships to today, when it is one of the larger independent
    exploration and production companies. After 54&#160;years in the
    oil and gas industry, Mr.&#160;Plank provides experience,
    contacts, and the ability to gauge appropriate risks that help
    guide the Company on its successful path. During 54&#160;years
    under Mr.&#160;Plank&#146;s leadership, the Company successfully
    navigated and survived multiple economic downturns, recessions,
    sustained periods of low commodity prices, periods of limited
    capital availability, and depletion of U.S. reserves to become a
    successful and growing international independent oil and gas
    company, positioned to take advantage of recent high commodity
    prices, without taking undue risks. The board of directors
    believes the Company and its employees are fortunate to have the
    ability to draw on the experience and perspective of our founder.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Mr.&#160;Plank complements and advises the chief executive
    officer and the CEO&#146;s direct reports and focuses on the
    long-range direction, capital allocation, cost controls, and
    strategies of the Company. Mr.&#160;Plank&#146;s
    responsibilities do not overlap with those of the chief
    executive officer. Mr.&#160;Plank&#146;s activities include
    direction of Apache&#146;s intensive, on-going programs to
    monitor, analyze, and respond creatively to the changes and new
    requirements in the oil and gas industry, and leadership in
    maintenance of sound business relationships with the management
    of many of the world&#146;s largest oil and gas companies. These
    relationships are important to Apache&#146;s strategic alliances
    and to its acquisition approach, which emphasizes privately
    negotiated transactions that develop and achieve mutual business
    benefits. Mr.&#160;Plank participates in developing the
    Company&#146;s strategies, capital allocation, cost controls,
    and setting corporate direction. The board of directors believes
    that Mr.&#160;Plank&#146;s continued service to the Company
    affords us a competitive advantage over our competitors.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    G. Steven Farris, our president, chief executive officer and
    chief operating officer, assumed the responsibilities of chief
    executive officer in May 2002. His activities include leadership
    in developing the Company&#146;s strategies, recommending and
    implementing the Company&#146;s capital expenditure programs,
    and maintenance of sound business relationships with the
    management of many of the world&#146;s largest oil and gas
    companies and with the investment community. Mr.&#160;Farris has
    been responsible for the Company&#146;s developing interest and
    successful exploration efforts going forward in international
    areas such as Egypt, Australia, the North Sea, Argentina, and
    Canada. As chief executive officer, he oversees all of the
    Company&#146;s major business and staff units, while guiding and
    developing Apache&#146;s senior management. Reporting directly
    to Mr.&#160;Farris is each of the executive vice presidents and
    corporate and regional vice presidents, including the chief
    financial officer and the general counsel.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
    <B><I>2007<BR>
    Corporate<BR>
    Performance</I></B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    As described above, 2007 was the Company&#146;s best year ever.
    Records were reached in all key categories of earnings,
    cash-flow, revenues, production and reserve growth. The Company
    increased its production by 12&#160;percent, its stock price
    increased by 62&#160;percent, which was second in our peer
    group, and it added $14&#160;billion of stockholder value in
    2007.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
<DIV style="text-indent: -12pt; margin-left: 12pt">
    <B><I>Chairman</I></B>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    The Company has had 22&#160;years of consecutive reserve growth
    and has increased production in 28 out of the last
    29&#160;years. Over the last 15&#160;years, the Company has
    grown reserves by an average of 19&#160;percent per annum and
    production by an average of 14&#160;percent per annum. The board
    and the MD&#038;C Committee recognize that this outstanding
    record of growth is the result of senior management&#146;s
    perseverance with its long-term capital investment program, in
    the face of significant countervailing pressures from outsiders
    for stock buybacks and other uses of Company cash that would not
    have positioned the Company to continue growing reserves and
    production into the increasing price environment of the past
    several years. This focus on long-term investments for the
    future, rather than short-term profits and results, is a direct
    result of the leadership of both the chairman and the chief
    executive officer.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    In 2007, the Company exceeded four of six of the Corporate Goals
    for the year.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">

    Based on the foregoing, including the 2007 corporate
    performance, and in light of the compensation decision making
    policies described above, the MD&#038;C Committee, on
    February&#160;16, 2008, increased Mr.&#160;Plank&#146;s base
    salary slightly from $1,450,000 to $1,500,000, which is
    approximately the 75th&#160;percentile Market Reference Point;
    and awarded Mr.&#160;Plank a cash incentive bonus for 2007 of
    $1,900,000, which was 132&#160;percent of his 2007 salary. In
    May 2007, Mr.&#160;Plank was awarded long-term incentives in the
    manner described above under Long-Term Incentive.

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 91%; margin-left: 4%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="25%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterleft -->
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutterright -->
    <TD width="73%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=maindata -->
</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
    <B><I>Other Named<BR>
    Executive<BR>
    Officers</I></B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Messrs.&#160;Roger Plank, Crum and Eichler have served Apache
    for a combined 54&#160;years. During this period, each of them
    has made significant contributions to the Company. After
    assuming the position of chief financial officer on
    August&#160;1, 1997, Mr.&#160;Roger Plank has been instrumental
    in managing the financial health of the Company. He has managed
    the complex financial matters related to the expansion of the
    Company into the global market place. The scope of his
    responsibilities is large and has continued to grow in recent
    years because of securities laws changes such as the
    Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002. Mr.&#160;Crum has overseen numerous
    international operations including increasing the performance of
    our North Sea properties, spearheading our Australia region and,
    most recently, leading our Canadian operations. Our Canada
    region comprises 23&#160;percent of the Company&#146;s estimated
    proved reserves, which makes it the second largest region in the
    Company. Mr.&#160;Eichler has spearheaded our Egypt region for
    more than ten years. He has been integral to the growth and
    development of that region. Due to growth during those ten
    years, Egypt has become the country with the Company&#146;s
    largest single acreage position and immense resource potential.
    In 2007, Egypt contributed approximately 18&#160;percent of the
    Company&#146;s total production.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    In 2007, the Company exceeded four of six of the Corporate Goals
    for the year. Once the additional credits are taken into
    account, the strategic objectives were also exceeded for the
    year.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Based on the foregoing, including the 2007 corporate
    performance, and in light of the compensation decision making
    processes and policies described above, including awards and
    recommendations by both our chairman and our chief executive
    officer and consideration of the performance of a Company
    region, as applicable, the Company awarded each of
    Messrs.&#160;Roger Plank, Crum and Eichler cash incentive bonus
    payments for 2007 of approximately 87&#160;percent of base
    salary, based on exceeding the targeted performance on both the
    Corporate Goals and the strategic objectives; awarded
    Mr.&#160;Crum an additional one-time payment of $50,000 in
    connection with his transition to Canada; and awarded each of
    them long term incentives in the manner described above under
    Long-Term Incentive.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    In recognition of the Company&#146;s outstanding financial and
    operational results that led to a record setting 2007, the board
    of directors authorized a special award of 12.65&#160;percent of
    the approved bonus that was given to all of the Company&#146;s
    employees except for the chairman and the chief executive
    officer. These additional awards were paid separately to
    Messrs.&#160;Roger Plank, Crum and Eichler but simultaneously
    with their regular incentive plan bonuses. The total of both
    cash incentive bonus payments for each of Messrs.&#160;Roger
    Plank, Crum and Eichler for 2007 was 97.5&#160;percent of base
    salary.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    On May&#160;16, 2007, the Company increased Mr.&#160;Roger
    Plank&#146;s base salary from $500,000 to $535,000, and on
    November&#160;1, 2007, increased Mr.&#160;Crum&#146;s base
    salary from $385,000 to $420,000 and Mr.&#160;Eichler&#146;s
    base salary from $355,000 to $390,000.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">

</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

    Our Named Executive Officers&#146; awards are reflected in the
    Summary Compensation Table and Grants of Plan Based Awards Table.
</TD>

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">

<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
    <B><I>Other<BR>
    Executives</I></B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Based on the achievement record described above, the MD&#038;C
    Committee recommended, and the full board of directors
    unanimously approved, a cash incentive bonus payment of
    approximately 115&#160;percent of the targets set for executive
    officers participating in the Annual Incentive plan described
    above that was applicable to our Named Executive Officers, other
    than our chairman and our chief executive officer. The special
    12.65&#160;percent award mentioned above was in addition to the
    regular incentive plan bonus payment.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">

<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">

</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 1pt">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
    <B><U>Tax<BR>
    Legislation</U></B>
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    The Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993
    (&#147;OBRA&#148;), as interpreted by the Internal Revenue
    Service on June&#160;4, 2007, imposes a limit, with certain
    exceptions, on the amount that a publicly held corporation may
    deduct in any tax year commencing on or after January&#160;1,
    1994, for the compensation paid or accrued with respect to its
    chief executive officer and its three highest compensated
    officers for the year (other than the principal executive
    officer or the principal financial officer). The MD&#038;C
    Committee continues to review the Company&#146;s compensation
    plans based upon these regulations and, from time to time,
    determines what further actions or changes to the Company&#146;s
    compensation plans, if any, are appropriate. It is the intention
    of the MD&#038;C Committee to receive stockholder approval for
    all future stock-based compensation plans so that they may
    qualify for the performance-based compensation exemption.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom" style="line-height: 6pt">
<TD style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    The Company&#146;s 1995 Stock Option Plan, 1998 Stock Option
    Plan, 2005 Stock Option Plan, 2005&#160;Share Appreciation Plan,
    and 2007 Omnibus Equity Compensation Plan were approved by the
    Company&#146;s stockholders and grants made under such plans
    qualify as &#147;performance-based&#148; under the regulations.
    The Company&#146;s existing incentive compensation plans,
    special achievement bonuses, Executive Restricted Stock Plan,
    and 2000 Stock Option Plan do not meet the requirements of the
    regulations, as the stockholder approvals necessary for
    exemption were not sought. However, these plans operate
    similarly to prior or other existing plans and are designed to
    reward the contribution and performance of employees and to
    provide a meaningful incentive for achieving the Company&#146;s
    goals, which in turn enhances stockholder value. No further
    grants can be made under the 2000 Stock Option Plan as it has
    since terminated.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
    Upon stockholder approval of the 2007 Omnibus Equity
    Compensation Plan on May&#160;2, 2007, the Company&#146;s
    Executive Restricted Stock Plan and 2005 Stock Option Plan were
    amended to allow no additional grants on or after that date.
    While the MD&#038;C Committee cannot predict with certainty how
    the Company&#146;s compensation policies may be further impacted
    by OBRA, it is anticipated that executive compensation paid or
    accrued pursuant to the Company&#146;s compensation plans that
    have not met the requirements of the regulations will not result
    in any material loss of tax deductions in the foreseeable future.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="top" style="border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 2pt">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>

&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">

</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
